transcripts.text: When I first got involved in the moon landing hoax movement and stuff, one of the websites that I turned to was the Bill Kaysing tribute site.  And, well, the webmaster of that site, he goes by the name of Albino Gallopini, he went off the deep end quite a few years ago and started promoting flat earth bullshit in his articles and in his YouTube channel and whatnot.  And I've tried to reason with him several times, and I thought... Completely done with him.  I am boycotting his website.

What happened with Gallopini is a great shame.  What happened with Gallopini, that is a great shame.  I mean, Gallopini was very good. It's a great shame that he has unfortunately swallowed the Flat Earth Kool-Aid, which I agree with you, Jarrah.  I think it's a great disappointment.  But I'm still very interested and I thank the man for the good work he did before that.

Thank you.  But if the Apollo missions were fake, how was this monumental hoax accomplished?  According to Kaysing, the launch of Apollo's Saturn V rocket was real.  It just never sent astronauts to the moon.

The astronauts were launched with the Saturn V. Then, in order to account for their disappearance, they simply orbited the Earth for eight days.  And in the interim, they showed these fake pictures of the astronauts on the moon.
